comment:
QA PRE-REVIEW: CR-099 v0.1 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-002/003: Dual-Template Architecture Procedural Controls" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- appropriate for v0.1

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present:
- Sections 1-9 (pre-approved): Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.2), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.4)
- Sections 10-12 (execution): EI table (4 items with VR column), Execution Comments, Execution Summary, References

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No draft placeholders ({{...}}) remain
- Execution placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) correctly present
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- Parent Document: INV-013 (CAPA-002, CAPA-003) -- explicitly stated in Section 2.1
- Bundling rationale documented in Execution Comments section

CONTENT ASSESSMENT:
- Section 5.1 (CAPA-002): TEMPLATE-CR usage guide addition clearly described with 4 specific content areas. Well-scoped.
- Section 5.2 (CAPA-003): SOP-002 Section 7.3 addition concisely specified. Verified that current SOP-002 Section 7.3 does not contain template alignment verification, consistent with Current State description.
- CAPA bundling is justified: both address related procedural gaps in the same change control workflow.
- 4 EIs are proportionate to scope: pre-execution, TEMPLATE-CR update, SOP-002 update, post-execution.
- Defense-in-depth rationale (author guidance + QA verification) is sound preventive design.

FORMATTING: Clean and consistent throughout. Tables, section numbering, markdown all correct.

TU ASSIGNMENT: None needed. Purely procedural document updates with no code or domain-specific content.

QA POST-REVIEW: CR-099 v1.2 -- RECOMMEND

FRONTMATTER VERIFICATION:
- title: "CAPA-002/003: Dual-Template Architecture Procedural Controls" -- present, descriptive
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- acceptable for self-authorizing executable document per SOP-002 Section 8

STRUCTURAL COMPLIANCE (SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present: Purpose, Scope (2.1-2.3), Current State, Proposed State, Change Description (5.1-5.2), Justification, Impact Assessment (7.1-7.3), Testing Summary, Implementation Plan (9.1-9.4), Execution (EI table, Execution Comments), Execution Summary, References.

EXECUTION TABLE VERIFICATION:
- 4 EIs present (EI-1 through EI-4)
- All Task Outcomes: Pass (4/4)
- No Fail outcomes, no VARs required
- VR column: blank for all EIs (none flagged during planning)
- All EIs signed by claude - 2026-02-22

CONTROLLED DOCUMENT VERIFICATION (SOP-002 Section 7.3):
Both documents modified by this CR have completed their own review/approval workflows:
- TEMPLATE-CR: v9.0 EFFECTIVE (confirmed via qms_status). Revision_summary: "CR-099: Add TEMPLATE CR PATTERNS section for dual-template architecture awareness" -- properly references authorizing CR.
- SOP-002: v15.0 EFFECTIVE (confirmed via qms_status). Revision_summary: "CR-099: Add template alignment verification to Section 7.3 QA post-review checklist" -- properly references authorizing CR.

CONTENT VERIFICATION OF CONTROLLED DOCUMENTS:
- TEMPLATE-CR: Confirmed "TEMPLATE CR PATTERNS" section present in usage guide (line 96), documenting dual-template architecture with QMS/TEMPLATE/ and qms-cli/seed/templates/ locations, propagation requirements, and alignment verification EI guidance.
- SOP-002 Section 7.3: Confirmed template alignment verification bullet present (line 229): "For CRs that modify templates: both QMS-controlled copies (`QMS/TEMPLATE/`) and seed copies (`qms-cli/seed/templates/`) are aligned and reflect the changes authorized by the CR"

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found in document body
- Execution template comment blocks appropriately retained

EXECUTION SUMMARY:
Section 11 provides complete narrative. Both CAPAs explicitly addressed with version and status evidence. No deviations from plan reported.

PARENT TRACEABILITY:
- INV-013 CAPA-002 and CAPA-003 referenced in Section 2.1 and References
- Bundling rationale documented in Execution Comments

WORKFLOW COMPLIANCE:
Audit trail confirms proper workflow: CREATE -> CHECKIN -> PRE_REVIEW (RECOMMEND) -> PRE_APPROVAL (APPROVE) -> RELEASE -> IN_EXECUTION -> checkout/checkin (2 cycles) -> POST_REVIEW. Procedurally compliant.

FINDING: COMPLIANT. All post-review criteria per SOP-002 Section 7.3 satisfied.
